definition: to inspect/to review/to read/to peruse/to go through/to experience
to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up
acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection
(of a pupil) to write down (in a dictation exercise)/dictation/(music) to transcribe by ear
lit. ripe as a melon that rolls from its vine (idiom); fig. to know fluently/to know sth inside out/to know sth by heart
dealing with red tape/paperwork/(Tw) word processing
lit. so loud that even the deaf can hear (idiom); rousing even the apathetic
essay on policy in question and answer form used in imperial exams
